Package weather.data

Class WeatherResponse

java.lang.Object
weather.data.WeatherResponse
public class WeatherResponse extends Object
Model class to represent a weather response, annotated to ignore unknown JSON properties. This class stores weather data, including timelines and location information.

  • Method Details

    • getDailyForecast

      public DailyForecast getDailyForecast(int dayIndex)
      Retrieves the daily forecast for a specified day index.
      Parameters:
      dayIndex - The index of the day for which the forecast is requested.
      Returns:
      The daily forecast for the given day index, or null if not available.

    • getFiveDayForecast

      public DailyForecast[] getFiveDayForecast()
      Retrieves the five-day weather forecast.
      Returns:
      An array of DailyForecast objects representing the forecast for the next five days.

    • getTimelines

      public Timelines getTimelines()
      Getter for timelines.
      Returns:
      The Timelines object containing weather forecast data.

    • getLocationName

      public String getLocationName()
      Retrieves the name of the location for the weather data.
      Returns:
      The name of the location.

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(Map<String,String> location)
      Sets the location details.
      Parameters:
      location - A map containing location details.

    • setTimelines

      public void setTimelines(Timelines timelines)
      Sets the timelines for weather data.
      Parameters:
      timelines - The Timelines object containing forecast data.

    • setFetchedAt

      public void setFetchedAt(LocalDateTime now)
      Sets the fetchedAt timestamp to the specified time.
      Parameters:
      now - The timestamp of when the data was fetched.

    • getFetchedAt

      public LocalDateTime getFetchedAt()
      Retrieves the timestamp of when the data was fetched.
      Returns:
      The fetchedAt timestamp.

    • isExpired

      public boolean isExpired()
      Determines whether the stored weather data is expired based on the validity duration.
      Returns:
      true if the data is expired, false otherwise.
